Review_pros: Very  easy  to  set  up  and  get  up  and  running  Easy  to  schedule  and  host  meetings  for  both  internal  and  external  parties  Simple  and  straight  forward  interface
Review_cons: The  new  way  to  present  content  and  share  screens  can  be  a  little  confusing  at  first  if "you re",  used  to  previous  versions  of  the  product.

Review_Title: Cisco Webex Meetings: Online meetings at their finest!
Review_body: In  my  organization "we ve",  experienced  issues  with  communicating  with  clients  in  other  countries.  With  Cisco  Webex  we  have  decreased  the  gap  for  meetings  and  are  able  to  get  more  done. "It s",  currently  only  used  by  the  management  team  but  want  to  expand  usage  across  the  organization.  We  know  that  Cisco  Webex  has  a  lot  of  cool  things  to  use  and  implement  for  our  meeting  rooms.  However,  before  we  invest  and  further  implement,  we  need  to  further  prove  out  the  business  case  internally.
Review_pros: Connecting  teams  and  clients  with  quick,  simple,  and  fast  meetings.Enables  my  team  to  experience  cutting  edge  meeting  and  web  conferencing  technology.
Review_cons: Price  -  In  comparison  with  the  other  meeting  technologies,  Cisco  offers  almost  all  the  same  functionalities  for  more  or  less  the  same  price.Would  like  to  have  better  linked  functionalities  for  other  technologies  (Zoom,  Slack,  MS  Office),  with  a  reduced  amount  of  RAM  consumed.Would  be  nice  to  have  a  starter  pack  for  new  offices,  bundled  one  in  one  pack  offering  for  companies.

Review_Title: Hassle free way to conduct long distance meetings
Review_body: Cisco  Webex  is  used  for  making  conference  calls.  It  enables  screen  sharing  without  any  delay  and  offers  high-quality  voice  transfer.  It  solves  our  communication  problem  with  not  only  inside  company  colleagues  but  also  partners  in  different  time  zones.
Review_pros: Desktop  sharing  without  any  delay.Since  it  was  a  browser  based  tool,  problem  with  security  barriers  is  not  allowed.
Review_cons: The  quality  of  app  might  be  improved.

Review_Title: Great tool to share audio and visuals
Review_body: We  use  the  program  to  have  meetings  and  share  audio  and  visual  aspects  from  our  computers  with  colleagues  who  work  at  different  sites  as  well  as  outside  the  organization  with  suppliers. "It s",  used  by  the  entire  organization  and  comes  as  a  default  program  in  work  computers  provided  to  each  employee. "It s",  easy  to  set-up  a  meeting  and  share  its  link  within  Outlook.
Review_pros: Easy  to  share  computer  screen  with  meeting  attendees.Manipulate  shared  screen  via  annotate  feature.
Review_cons: Meeting  times  sometimes  appear  incorrectly  for  different  time  zone  users.

Review_Title: Cisco Webex is very easy to connect and conduct
Review_body: We  use  Cisco  Webex  Devices  to  run  seminars.  In  our  department  we  have  a  regular  group  meeting.  We  have  some  experts  collaborating  with  us  from  outside  the  department.  We  use  Cisco  Webex  Device  to  connect  with  them.  It  is  very  useful  in  our  department  to  run  any  kind  of  meeting.
Review_pros: Easy  to  connect.Easy  to  communicate.
Review_cons: Sometimes  does  not  work  properly.Sometimes  difficult  to  share  the  screen.

Review_body: "It s",  used  by  a  particular  department,  for  meeting  with  international  users  and  partners.  Cisco  Webex  Meetings  allows  to  have  meetings  independently  from  PCs/devices  used  by  the  end  user,  with  very  small  support  needed  from  the  IT  department.
Review_pros: Full  web  interface  is  available  Easy  to  use/configure
Review_cons: Licensing  model

Review_body: We  use  Webex  Meetings  as  our  primary  webinar  and  collaboration  tool  across  our  organization.  We  tried  a  variety  of  other  platforms  due  to  the  cost  of  Webex,  but  in  the  end,  we  moved  back  to  Webex  Meetings  due  to  the  stability  and  ease  of  use  that  it  provides.  We  had  issues  with  outside  users  installing  the  client  on  other  platforms  or  at  times  they "weren t",  available.  Webex  Meetings  just  seems  to  work.
Review_pros: It  is  always  available  when  we  need  it.  Their  availability  is  second  to  none.People  seem  to  grasp  Webex "Meeting s",  flow  quickly  and  are  able  to  get  up  and  running  quickly  as  a  new  user.Once  the  meetings  are  up  and  running,  they  typically  stay  up  and  running.
Review_cons: The  biggest  and  probably  only  downside  to  Webex  Meetings  is  cost  when  compared  to  the  alternatives.

Review_Title: Webex is our ex for a reason.
Review_body: We  used  Webex  Meetings  to  host  webinars  for  100-500  members  within  our  organization.  Each  webinar  featured  slides,  speakers,  video,  and  screen  sharing.
Review_pros: Compatible  across  many  browsers/systems.Professional  appearance.A  known  name  in  the  meeting  space.
Review_cons: Installed  app  required.Many  technical  glitches.Slow  and  inferior  support.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings is the best web conference tool that I used
Review_body: Webex  is  used  across  the  organization  and  it  is  pretty  cool.  I  find  it  more  reliable  compared  to  other  meeting  tools.  Also,  the  URL  is  very  generic  and  we  can  easily  connect  audio  in  various  ways.  The  screen  sharing  very  good  and  it  helps  us  quickly  talk  to  people  remotely.
Review_pros: The  screen  sharing  feature  is  the  best  I  have  experienced  so  far.The  audio  connectivity  is  very  good.The  quality  of  the  call  on  Webex  is  just  awesome.
Review_cons: Sometimes  the  audio  on  the  computer  can  get  unstable.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings: the only tool you need for online meetings
Review_body: We  are  using  it  for  meetings  on  a  scheduled  basis.  We  are  using  the  tool  for  screen  sharing  to  work  with  staff  on  different  projects  and  applications  as  well.  We  have  been  using  Webex  Meetings  for  a  long  time  and  staff  enjoy  the  ease  of  working  with  the  tool  and  gives  us  the  ability  to  have  meetings  no  matter  how  far  away  someone  is.
Review_pros: It  is  very  easy  to  set  up  new  meetings  Adding  additional  email  addresses  is  great  Plugin  with  Outlook  365  allows  us  to  have  staff  create  meetings  on  the  fly
Review_cons: Would  like  to  see  the  admin  tools  streamlined

Review_Title: Cisco Webex, the video communications tool of today
Review_body: We  use  Cisco  Webex  Meetings  for  meetings  with  external  partners  when  we  need  screen-sharing.  It  enables  communication  that  otherwise  would  be  unavailable  outside  of  a  face-to-face  meeting.
Review_pros: Availability-  always  there  when  we  need  it.Customizable  -  fits  individual  company  needs.Fits  the  need  -  does  what  it  claims,  does  it  well.
Review_cons: Confusing  meeting  set-up  (might  just  be  how  my  organization  set  it  up).Screensharing "app s",  options  can  be  difficult  to  find.

Review_body: This  tool  has  helped  me  a  lot  to  improve  the  communication  between  the  work  teams  remotely  since  other  tools  have  great  difficulty  to  connect  due  to  the  licenses  and  domains  of  each  company.  My  recommendation  would  be  to  add  the  option  to  transfer  files  by  the  same  means  to  complete  100%  satisfaction  and  user  experience.
Review_pros: Connectivity  in  different  Network  domains  Stability  during  the  session  Appointment  Reminder  It  can  be  used  without  having  an  appointment  scheduled
Review_cons: File  Transfer  Remove  automatic  call  activation

Review_body: Many  of  our  users  across  the  organization  are  end  users  of  Webex  Meetings  set  up  by  other  parties.  Not  that  many  people  in  our  situation  are  the  Webex  meeting  provider/initiator.  Most  Webex  meeting  initiated  are  by  the  IT  department.
Review_pros: Reliable.Integrates  well  with  Outlook.
Review_cons: There  really "isn t",  anything  I  can  offer.  It  could  always  be  made  to  be  a  little  more  user  friendly.

Review_body: Cisco  Webex  Meetings  is  being  used  by  my  organization  to  collaborate,  meet  and  share  information  internally  and  externally  with  peers,  partners,  and  customers.  We  also  use  it  for  general  conference  calls,  whiteboarding,  and  polling  when  needed.  Cisco  Webex  Meetings  addresses  our  need  to  stay  connected  in  an  agile  way  without  much  overhead.
Review_pros: Ease  of  use.Sharing  content.Video  collaboration.
Review_cons: The  mobile  app  is  not  always  reliable.Disconnect  from  meetings.

Review_Title: Webex a great tool to collaborate
Review_body: We  use  Cisco  Webex  all  the  time;  we  need  it  to  share  ideas,  knowledge,  define  objectives  and  develop  projects  in  our  organization.  This  tools  is  very  important  to  share  all  points  of  views  and  get  our  results  ASAP.
Review_pros: Share  screens,  conference  calls,  save  money  on  calls.Talk  to  people.Record  meetings  for  training.Use  the  internet  to  call.Today  we  have  increased  the  number  of  meetings,  but  the  meeting  are  in  short.The  old  video  conference  was  very  obsolete,  this  is  very  good  system  to  have  for  a  conference.Using  it  on  mobile  is  a  great  experience.
Review_cons: nan

Review_body: "It s",  used  for  meetings  with  our  coworkers  in  Spain.
Review_pros: When  someone  is  speaking  Cisco  Webex  switches  to  the  video  of  the  person  who  is  speaking[Take]  over  the  presentation  if "you re",  not  the  presentator  or  organizer
Review_cons: Have  the  option  that  the  organizer  can  choose  multiple  moderators

Review_body: We  use  Cisco  Webex  to  hold  and  attend  online  meetings,  collaborate  on  team  projects,  and  share  documents.  In  addition,  it  is  very  useful  as  it  allows  us  to  record/capture  meetings  held  and  facilitate  business  discussions  for  distance/remote  meetings  saving  time  and  travel  costs.
Review_pros: Collaborate  on  team  projects.Share  documents.Hold  and  attend  online  meetings.
Review_cons: On-demand  webinars.Smart  forms  and  enrichment.

Review_body: Web  Ex  allows  me  to  talk  with  customers  and  set  up  design  reviews  where  I  can  share  my  screen.
Review_pros: Video  conference.Multiple  party  meetings.Phone  calls.
Review_cons: Video  quality.Complicated  menu  layout.Hosting  meetings.

Review_Title: Webex - Nothing More (than its peers), Nothing Less (unless you skimped on your license)
Review_body: Webex  is  being  used  in  our  organization  primarily  for  online  meetings  that  involve  screen  share.  It  is  currently  being  phased  out  in  our  company  in  favor  of  Microsoft  Teams  Meeting.  Because  of  our  licensing  agreement  with  Webex,  only  a  portion  of  the  users  were  able  to  use  integrated  audio  as  well.  Most  users  only  have  access  to  the  screen  sharing  portion  and  telephony  was  handled  by  a  separate  conference  bridge.
Review_pros: Webex  was  easily  accessible  throughout  the  org  for  meetings  -  the  integration  with  Outlook  was  pretty  good.Webex  did  a  good  job  with  screen  sharing  and  the  standard  webconference  (non-audio)  features.The  Webex  app  was  not  insignificant.  I  used  it  on  an  iphone  as  a  supplement  and  it  was  very  useful.
Review_cons: Not  inherently  connecting  VOIP  with  the  screen  sharing  meant  (for  us)  that  we  always  had  to  wrangle  2  tools  to  start  a  meeting  rather  than  1.The  Webex  desktop  app  was  helpful,  like  the  mobile  app,  but  the  primary  experience  our  company  was  likely  sold  against  was  the  web  version.  That  is  the  weaker  of  the  3  platforms.Webex  recordings  were  very  difficult  to  make,  edit,  download  and  convert.  Simplicity  would  have  served  them  well.Attaching  a  dial  in  conference  bridge  (again,  because  of  our  licensing  model)  was  a  below  average  experience.  VOIP  is  far  superior,  but  given  the  option  for  less  spend,  companies  will  often  take  it  even  if  ill-advised.
Position: Staff Project Manager, Awesomizer, Fixer, Maker, Collaboration Enabler

Review_Title: Webex Meetings is a great platform for remote collaborations and presentations
Review_body: At  my  current  company,  Webex  Meetings  is  currently  used  for  large  meetings  that  need  to  include  employees  not  onsite,  sharing  content  with  external  collaborators,  or  sometimes  internally  to  screen  share.  Sometimes "it s",  a  combination  of  those  reasons.  Internal  meetings  sometimes  include  large  training  sessions.  Personally,  it  has  helped  to  include  employees  that  work  offsite  or  at  home  that  need  to  attend  group  meetings.
Review_pros: Web  Ex  Meetings  enables  large  and  small  audience  meetings.  It  is  very  scalable.  It  can  be  an  interactive  meeting  with  3-5  attendees  or  a  webinar  with  over  100.The  host  can  configure  a  ton  of  options  for  the  meeting  so  that  it  can  run  smoothly.  i.e.  mute  all  attendees,  allow/disable  screen  sharing,  or  grant  access  to  specific  features  to  attendees.The  integration  with  Microsoft  Office,  especially  Outlook,  is  very  useful.  If  the  tools  are  installed,  a  Webex  meeting  can  be  created  and  added  to  a  scheduled  meeting  easily  at  the  same  time  as  scheduling  the  meeting.  Requested  attendees  will  automatically  have  the  meeting  link  in  the  invite.Usually,  attendees  do  not  need  prior  set  up  to  join  the  meetings.
Review_cons: Integration  with  a "company s",  teleconference  system  is  not  always  smooth.  If  it  were  up  to  me, "I d",  only  allow  Vo  IP  through  the  Webex  Meetings  for  audio.For  new  Webex  host  users,  the  learning  curve  can  be  steep  since  there  are  many  features  that  the  host  needs  to  be  sure  to  configure  and  know  how  to  control.The  user  interface  has  changed  quite  a  bit  throughout  the  years.  I  feel  in  the  last  few  years  the  colors  and  arrangements  have  made  it  more  difficult  to  find  things  in  the  Webex "Meeting s",  window  and  panels.Sometimes  attendees  are  joining  from  their  company  which  has  specific  desktop  restrictions  that  may  make  joining  the  meeting  not  intuitive  for  the  users.  It  would  help  if  they  could  detect  that  and  make  it  more  intuitive  for  the  user  to  know  they  should  run  the  stand-alone  temporary  exe  file,  for  example.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings - reliable, easy to use, great quality
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  across  our  organization.  It  is  used  for  internal  meetings,  meetings  that  include  external  partners,  and  meetings  that  include  customers  and  for  telemedicine.  We  use  it  across  various  types  of  devices  such  as  smartphones,  workstations,  tablets,  and  higher-end  Cisco  meeting  rooms.
Review_pros: Quality  of  voice  and  video  is  excellent.Compatibility  across  various  devices.Reliable.Easy  to  use.
Review_cons: A  little  better  GUI  for  those  that  provide  support  and  need  to  remotely  control  or  exchange  files.Update  Microsoft  Outlook  without  having  to  restart  Outlook.Provide  persistent  meeting  space  for  recurring  meetings  that  would  house  history  documents,  agendas,  and  communications  (e.g.  chat,  Q&A).

Review_body: We  use  Webex  for  contact  with  partners  and  clients.  We  also  used  for  technical  support  as  our  principal  support  tool.
Review_pros: Recording  is  a  really  a  good  advantage.  We  can  record  our  sessions  and  share  them  with  other  coworkers.Calling  service  with  different  options.  We  particularly  use  the  computer  option  which  is  easy  to  use  and  practical.Show  and  share  options.
Review_cons: Sharing  files.  Should  be  as  simple  as  just  move  from  my  desktop  to  the  shared  desktop.

Review_Title: Webex Meeting: a decent cloud solution for cloud conferencing, remote support and many more
Review_body: We  are  using  this  Webex  meeting  as  a  cloud  conferencing  bridge  for  video  conference  and  also  to  give  remote  support  to  our  customers.  Deliver  the  training  sessions  to  customers  and  internal  employees  using  Webex  Meeting  Center.  Our  HR  uses  Webex  Meeting  Center  to  conduct  an  interview  with  the  candidates.  Sales  review  calls  happen  on  Webex  where  conference  recording  is  needed.
Review_pros: Interop  with  on-prem  solution.PSTN  calling  option  and  anyone  can  join  using  his  video  conference  endpoint.Easy  to  join:  anyone  can  join  from  any  smart  device.
Review_cons: If  user  count  increases  to  50+,  then  the  active  speaker  switching  on  screen  becomes  very  slow.Polycom  video  endpoints  some  times  face  issues  when  joining  Webex  bridge.For  Webex  adoption  user  training  is  required  most  of  the  time.

Review_body: Webex  meetings  has  become  one  of  the  most  used  products  in  our  company.  In  our  Public  Saftey  Department,  it  is  used  for  all  of  our  officers  to  meet  remotely  without  the  need  to  come  into  the  office.  The  fire  department  is  able  to  meet  several  times  a  month  without  the  need  of  moving  fire  trucks  and  ambulances.  Since  moving  these  vehicles  causes  a  lot  of  problems  with  response  times  and  cost,  Webex  has  saved  us  a  whole  lot  of  money.
Review_pros: Enrollment  and  license  management  for  enterprise  users.Ease  of  use  and  documentation.Always  leading  on  cutting  edge  technology.Quickly  became  the  industry  standard.
Review_cons: Webex  meetings  can  get  costly  quickly.Reviewing  the  meeting  recordings  requires  a  specific  player.No  dark  mode.

Review_Title: Great collaboration product for your business
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  across  our  whole  organization.  We  use  it  primarily  for  meetings  and  sharing  content  both  internally  and  externally.  Engineering  also  has  specific  use  cases  for  it,  the  primary  one  being  remote  control  for  troubleshooting  with  customers.
Review_pros: Video  conferencing  Audio  conferencing  Sharing  content  for  meetings  Remote  control
Review_cons: Requires  a  client  for  full  functionality "Doesn t",  support  as  many  simultaneous  video  participants  as  other  products

Review_body: Used  across  the  organization.  It  benefits  us  by  making  us  more  agile  and  saving  time  and  money  on  travel  to  central  locations.
Review_pros: Remote  control  Collaboration  Convenience
Review_cons: Latency  is  sometimes  a  problem.Occasionally  slow  to  load.

Review_body: It  is  being  used  across  the  whole  organization.  I  do  wish  more  departments  would  get  on  board  with  it.  Being  able  to  meet  at  a  moments  notice  and  have  scheduled  meetings  is  nice.  We  have  a  room  kit  mini  and  its  tie  into  Webex  is  really  nice  as  you  get  the  whole  conference  room  and  you "don t",  have  to  worry  about  a  laptop  going  to  sleep  at  the  end  of  the  table.
Review_pros: Being  able  to  connect  from  any  device.Being  able  to  share  content.Using  the  Room  Kit  is  awesome!
Review_cons: Had  to  go  down  for  an  Organization  transfer/change  to  put  all  under  one  Organization.  But  as  of  now,  we  are  good!More  step  by  step  documentation  on  getting  all  the  bells  and  whistles  up  and  going.Trying  to  setup  the  Webex  Edge  calling  and  video  mesh  takes  a  bit  of  time.

Review_Title: Stay productive and connected with Webex
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  to  conduct  meetings  with  clients,  employees,  and  partners  not  located  in  our  immediate  area.  It  makes  it  easy  to  communicate  across  the  company  and  with  current  and  potential  business  clients.  Everyone  at  the  company  uses  it  from  time  to  time,  but  the  main  user  is  our  CEO  for  his  business  meetings.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  by  just  clicking  the  invite  link  and  getting  connected.Who  is  online  and  who  has  joined  the  meeting  are  visible.Webex  Meetings  can  call  you,  rather  than  using  your  phone  number  to  call  out.It  is  great  for  international  users.
Review_cons: I  would  like  to  see  where  you  can  hide  attendees  if  you  want  to  do  a  webinar  with  it.Pricing  option  for  Small  Businesses.

Review_body: Webex  is  our  company  for  our  online  meeting  system, "I ve",  been  using  it  since  2013  and  I  like  the  product.  Setting  up  a  meeting  or  joining  a  meeting  with  Webex  is  so  easy.  Especially  if "I m",  using  the  one-click  button  on  Outlook,  this  way  I "don t",  need  to  arrange  many  things  because  in  seconds  the  meeting  is  arranged.  It  is  very  good  for  international  meetings.
Review_pros: Easy  to  set  up  the  meeting,  with  just  one  click  and  the  meeting  link  is  ready.It  is  easy  to  join  a  meeting,  you  can  call  from  your  computer  or  phone.It  is  very  good  for  international  meetings,  you  can  use  it  from  anywhere  you  want.
Review_cons: Interface  is  not  good,  it  should  improve  in  time.I "don t",  like  the  background  color  and  the  button  types.Chat  is  not  so  effective.

Review_body: We  are  a  virtual  company  so  online  conferencing  is  our  lifeblood.  The  Web  Ex  product  is  very  buggy  and  the  service  is  horrendous.  Audio  on  calls  will  randomly  start  sounding  robotic.  It  took  me  8  attempts  (email/phone)  to  get  a  reply  from  my  account  manager.  Every  time  you  have  an  issue  you  submit  a  ticket,  but  it  takes  2  days  for  someone  to  get  back  to  you  (long  after  the  meeting  is  over.)  By  far,  the  worst  service  and  support "I ve",  experienced  with  any  technology  platform  we  have  licensed.  I  thought  we "couldn t",  go  wrong  going  with  a  well-known  brand  but  it  turns  out  I  was  wrong.
Review_pros: Average  at  best  Poor  audio  quality  Able  to  record  meetings
Review_cons: Very  buggy  Poor  audio  Behind  on  features  like  automatic  audio  transcription

Review_Title: WebEx Meetings is a must-have to bridge the gaps between individuals who work together, but in different locations
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  enterprise-wide  in  my  organization,  to  conduct  conference  and  video  calls.  It  closes  the  distances  between  our  businesses  by  allowing  us  to  have  live  face-to-face  discussions.  My  organization  is  global,  and  without  a  tool  such  as  Webex,  we  would  have  to  travel  more  often  to  attend  certain  meetings.
Review_pros: It  allows  us  to  share  our  screens,  fostering  participation  and  collaboration.It  enables  high-quality  video  calls.We  can  conduct  meetings  with  a  high  number  of  participants.  I  am  not  aware  whether  there  is  any  limitation.
Review_cons: The  sound  quality  is  very  good,  but  could  probably  be  improved.It  would  be  nice  if  one  of  the  attendees  could  record  the  meeting  in  their  individual  end  as  well.

Review_Title: An easy way to have a meeting
Review_body: We  use  Webex  meetings  within  the  whole  organization  and  it  helps  saves  travel  cost  and  also  to  be  able  to  connect  with  other  organizations  at  a  very  low  cost.  We  used  to  struggle  a  lot  in  assisting  the  business  to  have  meetings  outside  of  the  organization.  the  senior  managers,  executive,  and  board  members  are  very  happy  since  we  have  purchased  Webex  licenses.
Review_pros: Remote  video  conferencing.Webinars.Remote  sharing.Teleconferencing.
Review_cons: "It s",  the  easiest  way  to  connect  to  Skype  for  Business.Works  well  with  Cisco  devices.

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  used  primarily  in  our  marketing  department  when  fielding  creative  development  that  requires  more  than  just  a  "voice  over  the  phone"  correspondence.
Review_pros: Ease  of  use  Accessibility  Seamless  change  between  presenters
Review_cons: Default  browser  is  IEMore  mobile  options  Integration  for  varied  setups  with  different  users  for  a  meeting

Review_Title: Webex - the best  connecting tool for recording and sharing anything
Review_body: While  we  have  transitioned  to  Skype  meetings  recently  we  are  currently  in  transition.  Webex  has  been  used  (along  with  a  couple  other  tools)  for  several  years  and  we  used  Webex  prior  to  coming  to  JDI.  Not  to  mention  multiple  sessions  outside  of  JDI.  Currently,  there  are  targeted  internal  users  who  have  a  Webex  login  and  use  it.  We  use  it  to  host  remote  meetings,  conference  calls,  training  sessions  and  record  pertinent  partner  meetings  as  applicable.
Review_pros: Recording  presentations  or  training  Remote  user  group  meetings  for  any  purpose  Information  sharing  or  learning  across  multiple  geographies
Review_cons: I  feel  Webex  is  one  of  the  best  providers  out  there  no  room  for  improvement  in  my  opinion

Review_Title: Webex Meetings: More Than Just Collaboration
Review_body: Web  Ex  Meetings  is  used  throughout  the  company  and  has  helped  to  create  a  great  collaboration  experience.  Our  clients  can  see  what  we  recommend  through  video  and  the  ability  for  us  to  share  our  desktop.  Webex  is  definitely  a  great  way  to  keep  our  clients  satisfied  in  the  process  and  we  are  able  to  schedule  meetings  quickly.
Review_pros: Easy  to  schedule  meetings  with  clients.Can  see  exactly  who  is  on  the  call.Receive  notifications  of  upcoming  meetings  and  set  it  up  to  notify  when  someone  logs  into  the  meeting.
Review_cons: Need  the  ability  to  add  people  to  the  meeting  during  the  call.User  interface  needs  a  little  cleaning  up  where  you  can  chat  and  have  the  video  in  full  screen.Nothing  else

Review_body: Webex  is  used  through  the  whole  organization  as  our  means  of  holding  team  meetings  with  not  only  people  based  in  different  parts  of  the  UK,  but  also  our  field  sales  reps.
Review_pros: Ease  of  setting  up  a  meeting.Audio  connection  via  PC.Ability  to  select  which  screen  to  share  when  multiple  screens  are  used.
Review_cons: Can  sometimes  be  a  little  slow.The  chat  section "isn t",  always  clear  on  when  you  have  received  a  chat.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings: the gold standard in teleconferencing and collaboration
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  the  primary  collaboration  platform  used  by  our  organization.  It  is  used  across  the  whole  organization  for  meetings,  conference  calls,  and  remote  support  sessions.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  High  quality  audio  and  video  Wide  range  of  supported  devices  and  connection  methods
Review_cons: Recording  space  could  be  larger  Remote  support  could  be  easier  to  use  and  faster  to  get  connected

Review_Title: Webex helps teams of all sizes to thrive
Review_body: It  is  used  by  the  whole  organization.  It  has  helped  us  to  have  remote  meetings  internally  as  well  as  with  customers.  Compared  to  other  solutions,  it  is  very  easy  to  use  and  is  a  very  elegant  solution.  We  have  been  able  to  save  hundreds  of  hours  compared  to  in-person  meetings.
Review_pros: Presentations  White-boarding  Video  conferencing  Desktop  support  tool
Review_cons: Resource  utilization  Bandwidth  usage  optimization

Review_body: I  use  Webex  very  often  for  my  educational  activities  with  Cisco  Academy  Instructor,  both  for  conferences  and  in  classes.  I  certify  that  it  has  helped  me  a  lot,  and  the  problems  I  have  had  are  related  to  communications  in  my  country.
Review_pros: I  can  communicate  with  other  Instructors  and  students  outside  my  location.You  have  an  option  to  send  information  to  the  audience.
Review_cons: It  is  necessary  to  know  the  product  well  to  make  it  more  efficient.You  have  to  explain  to  the  audience  what  you  want  to  communicate.

Review_body: Our  organization  uses  Web  Ex  for  internal  meetings  and  customer  meetings  and  presentations  routinely.  Not  a  day  goes  by  that  I  am  not  consulting  with  an  internal  associate  or  an  external  customer  through  Web  Ex.
Review_pros: Screen  sharing.Ease  of  connecting.Video  experience.
Review_cons: Clientless  connections.

Review_Title: WebEx is an adequate communication tool but is quickly being outpaced in the market
Review_body: We  use  Web  Ex  when  we  need  to  connect  a  remote  party  or  speaker  into  a  live  broadcast,  or  need  to  distribute  audio  and  content  to  a  user  base  that  is  viewing  one  of  our  broadcasts.  We  occasionally  use  it  for  collaborating  during  pre  and  post  production  meetings  as  well  as  content  meetings  with  clients.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  and  manage  Works  across  multiple  devices  Very  few  network  restrictions
Review_cons: Not  enough  control  over  some  features  Audio/Video  quality  not  really  adjustable  for  fine  control  No  native  integration  for  a  broadcast  switcher

Review_Title: Cisco Webex Meetings brings collaboration to everyone
Review_body: We  utilize  Webex  meetings  for  internal  and  external  collaboration  with  employees  and  vendors. "It s",  used  on  a  daily  basis  for  small  stand  up  meetings  between  members  in  different  locations,  and  is  also  used  for  larger  meetings  where  rich  content  sharing  and  video  are  needed.
Review_pros: The  user  interface  is  fairly  easy  to  understand.Video  and  audio  quality  are  good.The  integration  with  Calendar  helps  with  reminders  and  links  for  starting  and  joining  meetings.The  Outlook  add-in  makes  it  easy  to  schedule  personal  rooms.
Review_cons: The  client  interface  used  to  cache  the  complete  list  recently  connected  personal  rooms.  Now  it  only  keeps  the  last  5.Sometimes  the  call  quality  has  issues,  but "I m",  not  sure  if  this  is  related  to  network  performance.

Review_body: We  use  Webex  within  all  Ford  across  the  globe.  All  of  our  online  meetings  both  withing  company  or  with  suppliers,  customers,  any  third  parties  will  be  done  on  Webex.
Review_pros: Online  meetings  are  pretty  easy  with  Webex.Any  presentation,  you  can  do  it  very  easy  on  Webex.Online  courses  can  be  given  by  your  side  with  ease.You  can  join  into  a  meeting  from  your  PC  or  phone.
Review_cons: The  user  interface  can  be  simpler.Connecting  via  phone  is  a  bit  tricky  as  well.  You  have  to  call  an  American  number  than  dial  some  numbers  to  join  in,  etc.  I  prefer  to  connect  through  my  PC  though.Servers  are  not  that  good  all  the  time,  some  times  there  are  issues  with  it.

Review_Title: Webex - The Ultimate Unified Conference solution
Review_body: We  use  Webex  as  our  unified  conferencing  solution  across  our  organization.  It  provides  a  unified  collaboration  experience  for  our  users  through  audio,  web,  video,  recording,  white  boarding  &  content  sharing  features  all  in  a  single  package  thus  eliminating  the  need  of  different  standalone  platforms  which  provided  either  one  of  these  features.It  has  allowed  users  to  join  meetings  from  anywhere,  anytime  through  the  wide  range  of  joining  options.
Review_pros: Unified  conferencing  solution  with  audio,  video,  recording,  content  sharing,  whiteboarding  features  Trusted  cloud  service  eliminating  the  dependency  of  on  prem  components  Integrations  with  Microsoft  O365,  Slack,  Google  Calendar  for  accessing  their  services
Review_cons: I  do  not  have  any  issues.

Review_body: We  use  it  to  collaborate  with  other  Institutes  and  Universities,  whether  its  a  simple  phone  call  or  a  video  bridge.
Review_pros: Converts  the  invite  and  links  into  email  and  calendars.Easy  to  use  features.A  recording  is  extremely  valuable.
Review_cons: Reliability  for  phone  calls  -  sometimes  the  circuits  are  busy.More  troubleshooting/self-diagnostic  tools  for  the  end-user.More  of  a  heads  up  prior  to  implementing  major  updates.

Review_body: Webex  was  integrated  heavily  into  our  daily  lives.  we  use  it  to  support  individual  users  or  to  support  entire  facilities  with  Emergency  calls  of  more  than  500  users.  The  best  part  of  Webex  meetings  is  the  availability  of  private  rooms  and  recording  your  work  to  go  back  at  a  later  date.
Review_pros: Private  rooms.Recording.Linking  to  Spark.Direct  meeting  from  Spark.
Review_cons: Requires  an  Engineering  lift.Update  and  maintenance.Hefty  price  tag.

Review_Title: Webex Meeting review from an end-user
Review_body: We  are  using  Webex  Meetings  for  our  whole  company  as  the  main  video  conference  method.  It  is  being  used  for  both  internal  meetings  and  meetings  with  vendors,  customers,  and  providers.  It  works  well  for  sharing  screen  content  and  at  the  same  time,  people  can  see  each  other  remotely.
Review_pros: Screen-sharing  remotely.View  each  other  remotely.Works  well  for  different  devices,  such  as  PC,  mobile  devices.
Review_cons: Not  sure  if  this  is  a  Webex  issue  or  not,  but "Cisco s",  room  kit "doesn t",  work  well  for  the  audio/mic  part.  =Integration  with  Outlook  seems  not  working  very  well  sometimes.It  would  be  great  if  a  user  could  choose  which  party  will  be  the  main  one.

Review_Title: A great option for restricted industries needing a local server
Review_body: Web  Ex  On  Premise  was  used  to  communicate  with  internal  and  external  users,  using  a  pure  meeting  format  and,  sometimes,  taking  control  of  the  other "user s",  PC  for  support  purposes.On  Premise  versions  are  not  as  capable  as  cloud  versions,  but  due  to  restrictions  of  the  financial  services  industry  and "company s",  way  of  doing  things,  it  was  the  selected  option  and  it  worked  very  well  for  a  small  deployment.
Review_pros: Multi-platform  access.No  user  needed.Easy  to  deploy  for  an  On  Prem  solution.
Review_cons: Video  quality  for  On  Prem  is  not  HD.Types  of  meetings  are  restricted  (no  Events,  Training,  etc.).Restrictions  regarding  capacity  of  hardware  and  software  upgrading.

Review_body: We  use  Webex  as  our  main  conferencing  platform  and  distance  learning.  Most  of  our  meetings  take  place  in  Meeting  Center,  although  some  use  Training  or  Events  as  well.  Little  use  of  Support  Center.  The  whole  organization  uses  Webex  for  conferencing.  We  also  see  some  use  in  the  reservation-less  audio  conferencing  portion  of  the  platform.
Review_pros: Quality  audio  Number  of  options  High  reliability
Review_cons: First-time  join  experience  could  be  improved.  You  can  join  a  test  meeting,  but  other  vendors  offer  more  complete  AV  loopback  for  first-time  users  to  have  more  confidence.Administration  options  are  disconnected.  Multiple  portals,  Webex  Administration  and  Control  Hub  should  be  combined  into  a  single  portal.Support  can  be  dicey.

Review_body: Web  Ex  Meetings  is  used  by  our  sales  team  for  various  purposes  like  training  within  the  team,  system  dumps  collection  from  customers,  presentation  to  customers  when  traveling  and,  vendor  system  demos  for  feature  capability.  It  helps  us  to  have  all  the  stakeholders  in  one  meeting  to  talk  face  to  face  with  no  one  required  to  travel,  so  the  PAN  India  team  can  discuss  different  solutions  and  share  views  in  one  go.
Review_pros: Just  a  click  in  Outlook  to  start  ad-hoc  meetings  and  the  call  back  option  is  awesome.  In  the  middle  of  a  conversation,  I  can  just  get  the  meeting  started  and  ask  all  to  just  join  in  and  get  all  sorted  within  a  minute.  Even  my  team  members  who  are  on  mobile  just  join  in  with  no  issues  faced  ever.Assigning  Privileges  to  participant  gives  good  control  to  the  conference.  We  have  more  control  in  our  conferences  and "it s",  easy  and  quick.
Review_cons: Annotation.  Multiple  ppl  should  be  able  to  annotate  on  the  fly  to  make  it  virtually  present  in  the  room.Cisco  should  try  to  get  the  video  presentation  like  Barcode  where  quick  and  easy  video  presentation  is  possible.  They  should  also  have  Pano  for  4  party  presentations  and  if  on  MPLS  they  also  allow  remote  users  in  another  location  to  share  the  presentations  and  videos.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings as a Bluejeans alternative
Review_body: We  have  deployed  Webex  Meetings  as  a  Blue  Jeans  replacement.  Besides  offering  us  the  option  to  license  very  user  at  our  university,  including  students,  faculty,  and  staff,  this  gives  us  other  perks  when  coupled  with  the  SPK-EDU  offering  Cisco  has.  We  never  owned  licensing  nearly  comparable  with  Blue  Jeans.  With "Meeting s",  tight  integration  with  Webex  Teams,  we  are  now  actively  deploying  Webex  Teams  to  the  entire  university  this  fall.
Review_pros: Recordings  Meeting  scheduling  Traditional  VC  room  integration
Review_cons: Video  centric  recording

Review_body: We  have  a  strict  Vendor  Access  Policy  in  place  which  dictates  any  access  by  vendors  is  monitored  by  a  member  of  the  Network  Services  Team.  Webex  Meetings  allows  us  to  quickly  set  up  a  meeting  and  to  grant  access  to  a  vendor,  maintaining  security  and  change  management  control.  We  also  use  Webex  Meetings  to  conference  and  collaborate  with  our  partners  during  the  design  and  review  of  new  software.  We  have  also  used  it  to  allow  remote  users  to  access  quarterly  or  other  adhoc  staff  meetings,  saving  mileage  and  labor  costs  for  the  commute  if  they  otherwise  would  have  had  to  travel  to  the  corporate  office.
Review_pros: Quick  and  easy  to  set  up  meetings  on  the  fly,  and  most  executives  can  be  trained  to  do  this  on  their  own.Allows  you  to  grant  access  to  non-employees  and  monitor  their  actions  while  they  are  on  your  network,  maintain  security,  and  change  control  management.Great  content  delivery  to  both  on  and  offsite  employees.
Review_cons: Occasionally,  granting  keyboard  and  mouse  control  does  not  work  which  requires  reconnecting.We  have  experienced  issues  with  billing,  namely  not  receiving  invoices.  Not  sure  why  it  is  so  hard  to  change  billing  email  address,  or  why  once  it  has  been  changed,  it  mysteriously  changes  back?

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  a  replacement  for  a  legacy  Microsoft  Live  Meeting  (and  now  Skype  for  Business)  install.  It  is  used  across  the  entire  organization  and  corporation.  It  solves  the  performance  issues  we  have  with  our  vendors  and  partners  solutions  (Zoom,  Blue  Jeans,  etc.).
Review_pros: When  vendors  call  us  using  Blue  Jeans  it  often  fails  or  will  not  dial  a  phone  number.We  often  have  issues  loading  client  software  from  Zoom  and  Blue  Jeans  and  it  wastes  meeting  time.Works  across  all  platforms,  PC,  Mac,  smartphone  and  tablet  for  both  voice  and  video.
Review_cons: Latest  client  update  caused  some  issue  on  where  attendee  list  is  located  and  how  the  new  icon  overlay  works.Cost  is  high  compared  to  some  Internet  startups.Skype  for  Business  has  an  integration  advantage  since  it  is  now  owned  by  Microsoft.

Review_Title: Webex Meetings -- great collaboration, and the best in the market.
Review_body: Our  entire  organization  uses  it  daily  for  internal  and  client-facing  meetings.
Review_pros: High  quality  screen "sharing.It s",  extremely  fast  to  start  a  meeting.Excellent  audio  bridge.
Review_cons: The  user  webpage  has  2  versions  --  modern  and  classic.  Classic  has  different  functions,  but  everything  should  be  consolidated.The  video  layout  controls  are  awkward  for  switching  between  filmstrip,  split,  and  active  speaker  views.

Review_body: nan
Review_pros: The  outlook  add-in  feature  is  excellent  because  there  is  the  ability  to  directly  add  a  Webex  meeting  to  a  calendar  invite  with  a  simple  click  of  a  button.The  recording  feature  is  excellent  because  we  work  with  many  different  countries  and  time  zones,  so  if  people  need  to  view  the  presentation  later  they  simply  just  need  to  view  the  link  with  the  recording.Webex  is  extremely  easy  to  join  via  computer  or  phone,  which  is  nice  for  anyone  on  the  road.  There  is  a  mobile  app  which  is  simple  to  use  and  allows  you  to  call  in  from  wherever.  This  has  been  great  for  clients  as  well,  as  they  find  Webex  much  easier  to  use  than  other  meeting  applications.
Review_cons: N/AN/AN/A

Review_Title: Great tools but lacks exceptional audio quality
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  being  used  daily  by  the  whole  organization.  It  helps  us  schedule  important  meetings  to  discuss  issues  immediately  without  the  need  to  meet  in  person  and  to  show  participants  these  issues.
Review_pros: Screen  share  is  very  easy  Ease  of  access  makes  it  easy  for  all  participants  to  join  Option  to  have  Webex  call  you  at  your  number  is  great  and  convenient
Review_cons: The  audio  quality  is  lacking  Some  participants  that  try  to  join  are  inundated  with  too  many  instructions  on  how  to  join  a  Webex  that  they  get  frustrated  Participants  get  dropped  in  the  middle  of  a  Webex  and  are  forced  to  rejoin  multiple  times  throughout  the  meeting

Review_Title: Pricey, but worth it for large webinars
Review_body: We  mostly  use  Web  Ex  for  meetings  with  external  clients.  It  is  used  across  the  whole  organization  with  a  variety  of  domestic  and  international  clients.  It  allows  us  to  conduct  large-scale  webinars  on  a  fairly  stable  platform,  and  then  distribute  recordings  of  those  webinars  to  internal  or  external  stakeholders  as  needed.
Review_pros: Allows  webinars  to  be  conducted  with  a  large  number  of  participants  while  remaining  fairly  stable.Allows  for  webinar  recordings  to  be  downloaded  and/or  distributed  quickly  and  easily.Allows  for  easy  screen  sharing.
Review_cons: It  never  saves  my  login  information,  so  every  time  I  join  or  create  a  meeting  I  have  to  log  in  again,  despite  telling  my  browser  to  remember  the  credentials.It  is  rather  pricey,  which  means  my  organization  does  not  use  it  for  internal-only  meetings.  We  resort  to  using  Skype  for  Business  instead.In  large  meetings  there  is  almost  always  at  least  one  user  who  has  trouble  connecting  to  audio,  causing  delays  in  meeting  start  times.

Review_Title: Easiest way to setup a meeting!
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  the  default  application  within  my  company  to  conduct  any  meeting.  Whether  you  are  working  remotely  or  in  office,  you  are  able  to  use  the  web  app  or  download  the  stand  alone  app  to  join  the  meeting.  It  is  a  simple  solution  that  is  straightforward  and  works  flawlessly  every  time.  Setting  up  or  joining  a  meeting  could  not  be  easier.
Review_pros: Anyone  is  able  to  share  their  screen  during  the  meeting  Ties  into  Microsoft  Outlook  as  a  calendar  invite  Works  whether  or  not  you  are  using  a  webcam  or  no  camera  Can  call  in  using  your  computer  or  it  will  call  your  cell  phone
Review_cons: I  believe  the  overall  UI  could  be  updated  for  a  more  modern  feel

Review_Title: My job would be nearly impossible without Webex Meetings
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  across  my  entire  organization.  Because  the  entire  organization  uses  it,  it  makes  it  very  easy  to  set  up  meetings,  confirm  attendance,  share  screens,  and  complete  conference  calls.  The  entire  organization  understands  the  etiquette  of  using  Webex,  and  its  functionality  is  very  easy  to  catch  on  to.  Webex  Meetings  addresses  the  business  problems  of  inconvenient  meeting  tactics,  making  for  less  time  needed  to  travel  or  set  up  conference  call  numbers,  and  more  time  to  have  discussions  and  get  work  done.
Review_pros: Ease  of  use.  Webex  Meetings  has  a  very  simple,  clear  layout  that  nearly  any  user  can  understand  and  operate.Reliability.  I  have  had  less  than  a  handful  of  occurrences  where  Webex  malfunctioned,  and  should  malfunction  ever  happen,  troubleshooting  is  easy.Functionality.  From  screen  sharing,  to  screen  recording,  to  video-chatting,  to  white-boarding,  to  sharing  notes,  to  instant  messaging,  Webex  covers  it  all.Inter-application  integration.  It  is  very  convenient  to  have  Webex  Meetings  work  directly  within  Outlook;  it  saves  me  immense  amounts  of  time  when  doing  my  job.
Review_cons: Preset  settings.  Depending  on  your  setup,  Webex  Meetings  may  open  your  camera  as  you  join  meetings,  among  other  annoying  things  that  you "can t",  change  the  settings  on.Low  ability  to  customize.  What  you  see  is  what  you  get,  as  far  as  formatting  and  display.

Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  for  online  meetings  among  different  departments  within  the  company  and  with  suppliers  from  outside  the  company.  It  is  used  across  the  company.  Webex  meeting  resolves  the  complicated  issue  of  having  to  meet  face  to  face  or  use  other  modes.  It  also  helps  in  minimizing  the  telephone  bills  when  we  are  having  oversees  meetings.
Review_pros: Good  for  online  meetings  with  multiple  people.Has  the  ability  to  share  screens  among  all  the  participants  where  everybody  can  see.  Anybody  can  be  made  the  presenter  very  easily.The  controls  of  the  screen  can  be  passed  to  anyone,  which  helps  in  troubleshooting.I  like  the  callback  feature,  where  the  meeting  can  call  you  back  on  your  phone.
Review_cons: Sometimes  the  Temporary  session  does  not  work,  and  you  have  to  click  on  the  link  multiple  times.

Review_Title: One of the best collaboration and virtual meeting tools on the market
Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  used  by  nearly  my  entire  team  within  our  business. "It s",  the  primary  tool  for  organizing  and  holding  a  virtual  meeting  with  partners  and  customers  without  leaving  your  location. "It s",  perfect  for  presentations,  meetings  or  even  a  simple  chat.  The  feeling  that  Webex  provides  is  quite  immersive  and  gives  the  same  feeling  as  being  in  the  same  meeting  rooms  as  the  client.  The  tool  is  used  on  computers,  smartphones,  and  tablets
Review_pros: One  of  the  best  collaboration  tools  on  the  market.Create  virtual  meetings  with  clients  and  partners  without  leaving  the  office.The  management  is  all  in  the  cloud.You  can  use  the  tool  through  a  computer,  smartphone  or  tablet.Great  video  quality  and  response  time.Compatible  with  Windows,  Linux,  IOS,  and  Android.
Review_cons: I  advise  you  to  have  a  good  and  stable  internet  link  so  that  the  quality  of  the  video  does  not  waver  during  meetings.I  do  not  see  anything  else  negative  at  this  point.

Review_body: Cisco  Webex  Meetings  is  currently  used  by  my  entire  company.  We  use  it  as  a  tool  for  video  conference  across  all  the  departments  and  also  to  meet  people  from  outside  the  company.  At  first  we "didn t",  have  a  tool  like  this,  but  after  the  Webex  Meetings  implementation,  video  conferencing  became  something  easy  for  everyone.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  Integration  with  Outlook  Agility  to  start  a  meeting
Review_cons: The  Outlook  plug-in  sometimes  simply  disappears  Video  quality  sometimes  is  not  very  good "It s",  a  little  hard  to  contact  support

Review_body: We  use  Webex  Meetings  when  we  have  a  very  large  group  meeting  or  where  we  wish  to  guarantee  compatibility  across  different  teams  or  external  organisations.
Review_pros: Compatibility  across  operating  systems  Ease  of  use  Audio  Quality
Review_cons: Supporting  Windows  USB  connected  headphones  Integration  with  other  products

Review_body: We  had  quality  problems  with  intercontinental  calls  when  we  use  our  on-prem  solution  and  got  complaints  from  executives.  Webex  Meetings  solves  our  quality  problems  with  dynamic  quality  control.
Review_pros: It’s  easy  for  even  non-technical  people  to  start  a  meeting  The  software  is  very  lightweight  and  runs  on  all  major  platforms  Easy  install/use
Review_cons: "I m",  hard  pressed  to  pinpoint  what  I  dislike  about  this  software

Review_Title: Webex Meetings is a great tool and immensely useful
Review_body: It  is  being  used  across  the  entire  organization  and  is  a  means  to  effectively  collaborate  with  other  colleagues  and  users  outside  of  the  company.
Review_pros: Screen  sharing  Easy  to  join  on  a  range  of  devices  Simple  to  join  and  use
Review_cons: Could  use  a  faster  load  up  time

Review_body: It  made  it  easy  to  do  webinars  in  my  company  when  rolling  out  new  products.  I  really  enjoy  the  ease  of  use  and  intuitive  design.
Review_pros: Screen  sharing.Meeting  organization  (the  ability  to  control  audio  and  other  aspects  of  the  meeting).I  also  like  the  Q&A  functions.
Review_cons: It  suits  all  my  needs,  so  I "don t",  have  any  criticisms  at  the  moment.

Review_Title: Webex meetings is a great tool for enterprise collaboration.
Review_body: It  was  being  used  across  the  entire  organization.  It  allowed  remote  offices  to  be  able  to  join  meetings  and  view  presentations  and  live  video.  It  increased  collaboration.
Review_pros: Collaboration  among  employees  and  vendors.Video  conferencing.Integration  with  mobile  devices.
Review_cons: Ease  of  use.Marketing  Webex  audio  bridging  as  well  as  web/video  conferencing.Licensing.

Review_body: Webex  Meetings  is  being  used  by  the  whole  the  organization  and  with  external  teams  such  as  suppliers  across  the  world.  The  thing  I  most  like  about  it  is  that  I  can  easily  share  my  meeting "room s",  link  to  people  to  have  a  quick  meeting.  I  can  either  select  "call  me,"  "I  will  call  in"  or  "connect  via  computer"  to  dial  in.  Additionally,  I  use  the  Webex  mobile  app.  It  is  very  useful  when  I  am  out  of  the  office  and  have  to  join  a  meeting.
Review_pros: Easy  to  dial  in.Your  own  meeting  room  is  always  available  and  the  link  can  be  shared  easily.Connection  quality  is  sufficient  enough.
Review_cons: Annotation  should  be  improved.  I  want  more  control  of  the  screen  of  who  is  given  an  access  code.I  would  like  the  power  to  accept  the  attendees.  If  a  meeting  is  extended  and  I  have  another  meeting  scheduled,  it  gets  confusing  who  is  on  what  meeting.I  would  like  to  record  the  meeting  to  enable  me  to  listen  again  when  needed,  like  when  I  have  a  meeting  with  some  colleagues  and  struggle  to  understand  them.

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  used  primarily  by  three  departments  across  our  organization:Training  -  Used  weekly  for  an  online  webinar  training  series.  Account  Management  -  Used  daily  for  system  support  and  one-on-one  training  with  clients.  Sales  -  Used  multiple  times  a  month  for  system  demos.
Review_pros: Teleconferencing  is  well-done  and  good-quality.  We  had  left  Web  Ex  for  another  solution  and  came  back  in  less  than  12  months  with  the  teleconference  functionality  being  one  of  the  main  reasons  why.As  a  meeting  host,  I  like  the  control  that  Web  Ex  gives  me  of  the  attendees,  especially  if  we  are  in  a  forum  discussion  and  there  is  extra  background  noise  that  I  need  to  mute  out.
Review_cons: I  don’t  know  if  this  is  user  error  but  we  have  issues  at  times  with  giving  control  of  a  computer  to  another  participant  during  a  Meeting  Center  session.I  would  like  to  have  more  control  over  the  video,  specifically  being  able  to  make  the  video  camera  the  source  that  is  shared  with  others  in  a  full-screen  mode.As  the  administrator,  I  would  like  to  be  able  to  have  more  branding  control.

Review_body: I  use  Web  Ex  meetings  with  the  support  departments  for  some  of  the  software  vendors  we  have  purchased  products  from. "It s",  used  by  these  teams  to  view  my  screen  and  to  get  temporary  remote  access  to  assist  with  troubleshooting  issues  in  our  implementations  of  these  products.  I  also  use  Web  Ex  for  user  feedback  sessions  with  these  same  companies.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  Widely  supported  Minimal  or  no  software  needed  to  get  up  and  running
Review_cons: Advanced  features  require  desktop  application  Expensive  to  license  Outdated  user  interface

Review_Title: WebEx -- Functional for Meetings with Multiple Devices
Review_body: My  organization  uses  Web  Ex  for  remote  meetings.  It  allows  us  to  include  more  participants  who  are  not  able  to  attend  in  person.  Participants  can  call  over  the  phone,  or  join  over  their  computers  and  laptops.  It  makes  giving  information  to  join  the  meeting  easy  (for  example,  providing  a  link,  calling  code,  etc.).
Review_pros: Multiple  participants  Multiple  means  of  participating  (e.g.,  phone,  computer)Easy  to  use
Review_cons: It  takes  a  while  to  learn  to  use  For  users  of  Web  Ex,  a  non-tech  friendly  FAQ  or  guide  would  be  helpful  Clarity  regarding  tech  specifications  can  be  clearer  (e.g.,  why  is  my  microphone  or  camera  not  working)

Review_Title: Great Software and Easy to use.
Review_body: I  use  Web  Ex  meetings  to  hold  and  participate  in  meetings  with  one  of  our  largest  customers,  a  Big  3  Automotive  manufacturer.  This  allows  us  to  share  information  from  anywhere  in  the  world.  Web  Ex  is  used  by  all  within  my  department,  Project  Management.
Review_pros: Sharing  Drawings  Sharing  Files  over  various  formats,  including  but  not  limited  to  Microsoft  Office,  PDF,  etc...Allows  independent "Call-in s"
Review_cons: Some  things  I  would  like  to  see  improved  are  less  numbers/options  for  call  ins.  Seems  like  you  can  call  into  many  different  numbers  and  it  does  get  confusing.Some  other  things  I  would  like  to  see  improved  would  be  a  user  friendly  app  that  could  be  used  from  your  phone.  This  would  allow  complete  mobility  with  the  software.

Review_Title: Great Meeting Tool, East to Use
Review_body: It  is  being  used  in  the  North  American  branch  of  my  company.  It  helps  us  communicate  internally  in  a  group  setting  but  is  also  used  for  external  meetings  remotely.  In  my  experience,  I  have  used  it  mostly  externally-facing  with  clients  or  customers. "It s",  very  easy  to  use.
Review_pros: Allows  dial-in  calls.Holding  remote  meetings.
Review_cons: Screen  sharing.  It  always  seems  choppy  and "I ve",  encountered  many  people  who  are  confused  by  how  to  allow  screen  sharing.

Review_Title: WebEx - the tech guru's meeting platform
Review_body: Web  Ex  is  scattered  throughout  the  organization  and  previous  organizations "i ve",  worked  for.  Web  Ex  integrates  well  with  a  variety  of  services  and  physical  platforms  we  use  allowing  us  to  have  a  singular  platform  to  collaborate  on.  This  platform  really  solves  the  question  of  how  to  we  actively  collaborate  and  share  with  remote  employees  by  allowing  us  to  quickly  create  meetings  for  on  the  fly  sharing.
Review_pros: It  is  very  easy  to  set  up  a  webex  meeting.  This  allows  teams  to  quickly  get  together  and  on  the  same  page  during  critical  events  Webex  is  a  robust  platform  offering  a  variety  of  options  to  connect.  Whether "you re",  travelling  or  in  office "there s",  a  way  to  dial  in  and  begin  sharing  Webex  is  reliable.  Along  with  the  ease  of  use  this  platform  never  fails  us  and  always  delivers.
Review_cons: Some  of  the  products  this  platform  is  developed  to  work  on  can  be  a  pain  to  get  launched  and  connected  at  times.  General  use  and  setup  is  easy  but  some  of  the  cisco  integrations  are  a  little  tediousthe  software  itself  is  a  little " busy",  unlike  some  of  the  other  meeting  platforms  there  are  a  large  amount  of  options  available,  and  while  this  is  a  benefit  for  some,  some  of  the  less  frequent  users  might  find  it  a  bit  difficult.

Review_Title: Traditional, Safe Choice, but Not Intuitive
Review_body: My  organization  used  Web  Ex  Meetings  for  much  of  our  video  and  audio  conferencing  needs,  both  within  the  organization  and  with  external  clients.  As  we  are  located  on  both  sides  of  the  country  and  our  clients  were  dispersed  across  the  US  and  overseas,  this  allowed  us  to  communicate  with  each  other  relatively  easily.
Review_pros: The  calendar  on  the  platform  provides  a  good  visual  as  to  when  meetings  are  scheduled.  It  helps  when  we  are  scheduling  new  meetings  to  be  able  to  easily  see  when  meetings  are  already  scheduled  to  start  and  end,  so  we  can  avoid  double-booking.There  are  many  features  within  the  application,  including  the  ability  to  share  and  upload  files  to  present,  a  feature  we  used  often. "It s",  helpful  when  trying  to  explain  projects  and  complex  ideas  to  clients  to  have  something  visual  to  show  them.There  are  many  options  in  terms  of  package  and  prices,  and  in  certain  cases  we  can  work  with  an  account  manager  to  customize  the  service(s)  we  need  as  an  organization.  What  we  had  and  were  paying "wasn t",  something  that  was  shown  on  the  website,  which  was  both  a  pro  and  a  con  because  it  did  get  a  bit  confusing.
Review_cons: Sometimes  the  video  quality  goes  way  down  and  we  can  barely  see  the  faces  of  the  people  on  the  other  end.  This  may  have  to  do  with  the  internet  connectivity,  as  the  other  party  is  our  team  in  a  different  location,  and  we  know  they  use  the  same  (high  quality)  camera  all  the  time,  so "it s",  not  due  to  the  camera.We  upload  files  to  share  during  the  meetings,  and  it "won t",  take  certain  files.  Last  I  checked,  the  main  one  was  PDF  files,  which  sometimes "we d",  prefer  since  it  preserved  formatting,  but  they  cannot  be  uploaded.  Also,  at  times  the  files  get  distorted,  where  certain  figures  and  formatting "doesn t",  show  up,  or  the  whole  page  gets  shifted.The  amount  of  cloud  storage  is  very  limited,  and  that  was  difficult  for  us,  as  we  held  most  of  the  company  meetings,  calls,  and  training  through  here  and  were  looking  to  record  and  save  the  important  information.  We  ended  up  looking  elsewhere  and  configuring  a  process  to  convert  and  save  the  recorded  files  elsewhere.The  recorded  files  are  in  an  uncommon  form,  one  that  can  only  be  played  through  Web "Ex s",  own  tool/software.  That  made  it  extremely  difficult  to  download  and  share.  We  figured  out  a  process  to  convert  them  into  mp4  and  mp3  files,  but  that "wasn t",  an  easy/efficient  process.

Review_body: We  used  Web  Ex  Meetings  for  ad  box  meetings  internally  as  well  as  external  screen  sharing  presentations.  We  also  consulted  other  companies  on  their  Web  Ex  use.
Review_pros: Simple  to  use,  easy  for  even  the  least  tech  savvy  Recognized  brand  Good  for  companies  with  larger  deployments
Review_cons: Can  be  expensive  and  too  many  deployment  options  which  are  confusing  Simple  but  unspectacular

Review_Title: Cisco WebEx is easy going solution for meeting collaboration for Enterprises.
Review_body: Its  been  fantastic  experience  to  use  this  tool.  It  is  mainly  used  for  conducting  online  meetings,  group  chat,  video  chats  and  remote  training  purpose.  Yes,  it  is  used  by  whole  organization.  Its  working  perfectly  fine,  I  like  its  wide  variety  of  features  like  presenter  control  screen  sharing  and  recording  etc.
Review_pros: Easy  to  use  interface  Presenter  controls  Audio  connectivity  options  Screen  sharingvideo  chats  quality
Review_cons: It  can  be  made  cost  effective  of  small  sized  enterprise  A  help  guide  should  be  made  available  at  main  interface  Few  more  options  can  be  added

Review_Title: Webex the best platform for meetings
Review_body: We  use  it  mainly  for  our  meetings  with  our  remote  team  members.  Currently,  it  is  being  used  in  few  departments.  Whenever  we  want  to  have  a  global  call  we  often  go  with  Web  Ex  Meetings. "It s",  easy  to  use  and  connectivity  makes  us  choose  it  as  a  go-to  option  for  any  meetings.
Review_pros: Connectivity  is  the  key,  it  works  really  well  with  any  internet  speed  Audio  is  quite  clearcollaboration  with  other  softwares  (e.g.  Outlook)
Review_cons: Whenever  an  organizer  has  not  yet  started  the  meeting,  and  another  individual  dials  in,  they  should  receive  a  message  about  the  organizer  not  starting  the  call.Delays  in  long  distance  callsscreen  widths  are  an  issue  at  times

Review_Title: The new WebEx: not your grandpa's conference suite!
Review_body: Remote  meeting  is  becoming  the  norm,  as  our  campuses  expand  across  the  world.  Additionally,  more  and  more  we  are  being  asked  to  do  more  with  less--less  people,  less  money,  and  less  time  to  accomplish  the  task.  But  the  workload  is  ever  increasing.  So  if  I  can  host  a  Web  Ex  meeting  with  a  number  of  colleagues  across  NYC,  I  can  maximize  their  time--no  travel;  I  can  stay  on  point  with  an  agenda.  I  have  a  recording  of  the  meeting  to  show  later  to  folks  absent.  For  training,  this  last  point  is  a  must.
Review_pros: For  training--the  ability  to  record  a  presentation  by  a  vendor  for  reference  later  is  valuable.Conference  calling--  it  works  flawlessly  Video  conference--  hosting  in  a  private  room  is  great.  Keeps  the  level  of  professionalism  high.
Review_cons: Web "Ex s",  "Help  central"  is  a  robust  on-line  database  of  solutions.  However,  it  is  way  too  text  heavy.  Look  for  ways  to  implement  more  visuals  for  most  requested.Look  for  ways  to  implement  static  and  not  video  visuals  for  most  requested.

Review_Title: A trusted webinar provider that is easy to use
Review_body: Web  Ex  Meetings  is  a  great  tool  that  allows  businesses  to  communicate  and  exchange  information  globally  through  conference  calls  or  webinar  platforms.  I  have  used  this  interface  many  times  to  perform  live  meetings,  trainings,  and  presentations.  The  interface  is  easy  to  use  and  is  not  overly  complicated.  I  would  recommend  this  platform  for  new  users.
Review_pros: Ability  to  communicate  globally.  There  are  connection  numbers  for  almost  every  country  to  dial  into  the  platform.Speed  of  the  webinar  is  satisfactory  and  works  with  any  browser.  Easy  for  first  time  users  to  login  and  join  as  a  guest.Easy  dial-in  codes  and  Vo  IP  access.  Easy  to  follow  instructions.Easy  functions  including:  Ability  to  share  screens  or  any  application,  Easy  to  pass  over  presenter  role  and  ability  to  mute  all  attendees.
Review_cons: I  don’t  remember  seeing  a  recording  option.  There  may  have  been  one  but  I  don’t  recall.  If  it’s  not  available,  I  would  like  to  see  this  as  an  option.Ability  to  invite  more  attendees  to  the  web  meetings.  Some  competitors  have  higher  availability  of  attendees  available.Sound  quality  is  always  key.  I  think  it’s  pretty  good  now  but  there  is  always  improvements  to  sound  quality  and  optimized  speeds  as  well.

Review_Title: my experience with webex meeting software.
Review_body: It  is  used  across  my  organization,  very  useful  and  comfortable  tool  to  manage  web  meeting  and  especially  technical  screen  sharing  activities
Review_pros: several  options  to  connect  sound  and  visualsseveral  options  to  operate  a  multiparty  meeting  to  the  convenience  of  everyonestreamline  sharing  without  many  hickupsoption  to  record  a  meeting  and  or  a  screen  sharing  session  for  further  analysis  (for  example  for  helpdesk  centers)
Review_cons: hiccups  and  frozen  sessions  do  happen  from  time  to  time,  but  not  often.

Review_body: It  is  being  used  by  the  enterprise.  I  work  with  lots  of  international  employees  and  therefore  it  helps  to  bridge  that  gap  of  virtual  work.  It  also  helps  us  to  collaborate  on  projects  with  the  software  and  ability  to  share  documents  etc.
Review_pros: The  ability  to  share  content  -  employees  can  collaborate  on  documents  in  real-time.
Review_cons: There "isn t",  anything  that  I  feel  is  missing  at  this  time.

Review_Title: Why I use WebEx and why I am happy about it
Review_body: We  use  it  across  the  whole  organization;  we  use  it  internally  and  to  meet  with  customers.  The  primary  use  is  meetings/sharing  presentations,  but  we  also  use  it  for  "simple"  conference  calls.It  allows  us  to  reach  out  and  meet  customers  that  otherwise  would  need  to  travel  (or  we  would  need  to  travel  to  them);  it  addresses  "quick/focused"  meetings.  If  we  need  to  set  a  1-hour  meeting  it  makes  no  sense  to  travel  2  hours  forth  and  back.  This  tool  addresses  this  issue.
Review_pros: Screen  OR  application  sharing.  You  can  share  your  screen  (and  give  remote  control)  or  you  can  just  share  the  program/presentation  relevant  to  the  meeting.Call  in.  No  need  to  set  up  anythyng,  a  button  does  it  all.Polls.
Review_cons: The  Web  plugin  does  not  always  start  "right  away".There  is  a  single  chat  window;  maybe  there  could  be  multiple  chat  windows  (one  public,  one  private).It  would  be  nice  to  give  the  chance  for  the  audience  to  scroll  back  on  a  presentation.

Review_body: The  entire  organization  that  I  recently  came  from  used  Web  Ex  across  the  organization.  With  a  lot  of  companies  allowing  remote  working  capability,  I  think  this  was  an  amazing  tool  for  the  business  and  allows  people  to  literally  be  in  different  countries  and  have  meetings  where  they  are  able  to  meet  in  a  "face  to  face"  type  situation.
Review_pros: Allows  users  to  record  meetings  in  order  to  share  with  those  who  could  not  attend  as  well  as  for  time  capsule  types  of  situations  to  catch  people  up  on  past  conversations  they  may  not  know  about.Simplicity  of  private  rooms  and  distinct  URLs  for  the  rooms  Nearly  unlimited  number  of  participants  (  in  my  personal  experience)  with  control  over  chat  features  within  the  tool  The  control  the  organizer  has  is  impeccable
Review_cons: I  honestly  can  not  think  of  anything.  I  have  not  had  any  issues  with  the  system  itself.

Review_Title: Cisco WebEx - The more I use it the more I like it.
Review_body: We  use  Web  Ex  primarily  for  desktop  sharing  for  collaboration/remote  control  outside  our  company.  Some  of  the  other  features  we  use  are  recording  and  the  productivity  tools.  Being  able  to  easily  add  Web  Ex  to  a  meeting  in  Outlook  with  these  tools  streamlines  the  process  for  our  users.  Web  Ex  is  currently  used  in  select  departments  but  we  do  get  requests  to  expand  its  use.  Web  Ex  permits  users  who  cannot  meet  in  person  to  collaborate  in  multiple  ways  to  work  together  efficiently.
Review_pros: "I ve",  found  the  VOIP  feature  in  Web  Ex  to  work  very  well.  It  permits  me  to  switch  between  multiple  audio  devices  connected  to  my  PC  and  the  controls  are  easy  to  use.  This  is  a  specific  feature "I ve",  struggled  with  in  competitive  solutions.The  recording  feature  in  Web  Ex  is  very  easy  to  use.Passing  roles  to  other  participants  is  very  easy  to  do  in  Web  Ex.
Review_cons: Recording  in  Web  Ex  when  a  third  party  conference  bridge  is  used  has  been  challenging  for  us.Web  Ex  is  usually  near  the  top  when  it  comes  to  price  when "I ve",  looked  at  other  solutions.

Review_Title: WebEx Meeting Center - Easy to use and plenty of features
Review_body: We  use  Web  Ex  Meeting  Center  (MC)  as  a  virtual  communication  and  collaboration  tool.  Primarily  for  project  updates,  learning  sessions  and  team  communication.  The  problem  Web  Ex  MC  solves  is  a  common  communication  tool  for  groups  and  teams  that  work  virtually;  whether  they  are  in  the  office,  at  a  client  site,  working  from  home,  or  traveling.
Review_pros: Ease  of  access.  This  is  critical  for  a  global,  mobile  organization.Some  good  and  easy-to-use  virtual  tools.  These  tools  enable  effective  facilitation  and  team  engagement.Always  available.
Review_cons: I "don t",  have  any  feedback  for  this  question  at  this  time.

Review_body: Web  Ex  has  a  simple  user  interface,  although  it’s  slightly  less  intuitive  than  Go  To  Meeting’s.  Users  can  easily  share  their  desktops,  as  well  as  documents  or  any  application  on  their  computer.  It  is  quick  and  easy  to  change  presenters,  create  whiteboards  and  pass  keyboard  and  mouse  control,  making  for  a  seamless  meeting  experience.
Review_pros: Screen  sharing  Easy  to  use  Speaking  capabilities  through  a  phone  or  via  Vo  IP
Review_cons: IE  is  the  chosen  default  browser  It  can  be  confusing  at  times  for  1st  time "users.Doesn t",  offer  operator  assistance

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  an  excellent  tool  for  conducting  various  sessions  and  webinars  on  interesting  topics  in  real  time.  Participation  in  such  webinars  can  be  accepted  by  any  person  who  is  in  any  place  of  the  globe  if  he  has  Web  Ex.  Also,  this  tool  can  be  used  to  conduct  various  training  sessions  online,  without  leaving  home.
Review_pros: Conducting  webinars  Training  You  can  hold  online  meetings  without  leaving  your  home  Presence  of  mobile  application
Review_cons: Disadvantages  have  not  yet  been  identified

Review_Title: WebEx Meeting : Best Virtual Meeting application
Review_body: Web  Ex  Meeting  is  one  of  the  best  virtual  meeting  software.  Our  organisation  is  using  it  to  save  on  unnecessary  travel  costs  by  motivating  meeting  organizers  to  go  for  a  virtual  meeting.  Cisco  Web  EX  meetings  is  very  simple,  attractive  and  easy  to  use.  Our  organization  is  using  it  as  a  cost  effective  product  for  meeting  related  travel.
Review_pros: Simple  and  attractive  UIOne  click  to  share  your  screen/files  Ask  for  Control  One  click  to  3  options  for  voice  connection  Individual  and  everyone  chat  option  Participant  view  option  Easy  mute  and  video  sharing  option  White  notepad
Review_cons: "I m",  having  a  problem  with  calls  on  my  no.  option  Meeting  preparation  time  should  be  improved  Get  disconnect  sometimes  while  returning  from  sharing  a  screen

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  widely  used  across  the  company  for  meeting  purposes.
Review_pros: Shows  which  user  is  speaking.Easy  connection.Light  weight  and  can  be  easily  installed  on  a  mobile  phone  as  well.We  can  ask  the  webex  app  to  call  us  to  get  connected  on  a  bridge.

Review_Title: Takes Meetings to the Next Level!
Review_body: We  use  Web  Ex  Meetings  for  certain  client  accounts,  rather  than  across  the  entire  organization.  Web  Ex  Meetings  is  very  easy  to  install  and  use,  and  allows  us  to  utilize  screen  sharing  with  multiple  people  so  that  we  can  follow  along  with  our  agendas  more  easily.  It  also  allows  us  to  track  who  is  in  the  meeting  and  who  is  speaking  at  a  certain  point  in  time.  It  definitely  enhances  the  usual  conference  call.
Review_pros: Simple  screen  sharing.Chat  and  survey  capabilities.Ability  to  see  who  is  on  your  call  at  any  point  in  time.
Review_cons: Have  sometimes  had  other  users  have  connectivity/sound  issues  that  were  not  the  result  of  them  muting  themselves.  Required  them  to  dial  back  in  order  to  fix  the  issue.Premium  price.

Review_Title: Why I think Webex is the best Conference solution.
Review_body: Cisco  Webex  is  used  for  meetings  with  remote  individuals  and  people  who  simply "don t",  want  to  leave  their  desk.  Webex  is  the  standard  for  business  meetings.  You  can  use  Webex  to  share  content  or  simply  as  a  conference  bridge.  Meetings  have  become  more  efficient  for  everyone  that  uses  Webex.
Review_pros: Integration  with  Outlook,  and  Mobile  devices  The  ease  to  join  a  meeting  from  any  computer  Knowing  who  is  in  your  conference  room  and  the  ability  to  mute  people  who "can t",  mute  themselves.
Review_cons: The  whiteboard  function  is  very  basic.  Being  able  to  draw  on  top  of  images  would  be  great.Integration  with  other  video  collaboration  could  be  useful  in  the  future.HTML  5  web  client  and  not  having  to  install  a  client  would  be  good  for  the  future.

Review_body: Web  Ex  Meetings  are  used  internally  for  our  users  to  perform  software  demos  all  across  the  world.  Visiting  client  locations  in  hopes  of  a  sale  is  too  costly  in  time  and  expenses,  especially  when  you  are  reaching  globally.  With  Web  Ex  we  are  able  to  make  initial  contact  with  faces  that  match  the  voices  and  clear  screen  sharing  that  makes  that  leap  across  the  miles.
Review_pros: Easy  to  implement.  With  a  simple  add-on  to  a  laptop  or  desktop  you  are  one  click  away  from  starting  your  meeting.Easy  for  the  recipient  on  the  other  end  to  join  with  very  few  clicks  so  you  are  not  clunking  around  desperately  trying  to  get  them  to  connect  with  you.Their  accounting  and  support  team  are  very  easy  to  reach  and  make  sure  you  are  getting  the  proper  plan  to  meet  your  needs.
Review_cons: The  ability  of  making  host  accounts  can  be  somewhat  confusing.Less  hold  time  when  calling  support.

Review_body: Web  Ex  is  the  deployed  global  standard  for  the  enterprise.  It  is  a  strategic  tool  for  event  services,  in-house  collaboration  and  client  facing  communications.
Review_pros: Global  reliability,  even  in  challenging  countries  VOIP  access  for  audio  Well  known  interface  makes  for  easy  call  setup
Review_cons: Licensing,  while  better,  is  a  little  difficult  to  navigate  It  is  a  more  expensive  solution  than  other  competitive  products
Position: Senior Manager, Voice and Data Infrastructure

Review_body: It  is  used  across  the  whole  organization.  We  use  it  for  virtual  meetings  and  to  offer  virtual  training  opportunities.  We  also  use  it  for  immediate  screen  sharing.
Review_pros: "It s",  very  easy  to  launch  a  quick  meeting.Each  user  in  our  organization  has  their  own  meeting  room,  which  helps  with  scheduling  meetings  through  Outlook.The  ability  to  integrate  with  our  LMS  for  virtual  training.
Review_cons: Honestly  there "isn t",  much.  One  thing  might  be  that  we  experience  some  latency  at  times  while  we  are  sharing  a  system  on  the  screen.

Review_Title: Excellent Virtual Meeting Hosting Product---Cisco WebEx
Review_body: Web  Ex  Meetings  is  used  by  the  entire  company  and  by  various  departments.  The  main  advantage  is  to  have  virtual  meetings  at  the  same  time  between  various  consultants  and  clients  at  various  geographical  locations.  One  single  Web  Ex  meeting  can  save  a  huge  amount  of  time  between  consultants  and  client.  This  helps  to  save  plenty  of  business  hours  which  can  be  utilized  for  other  business  operations.
Review_pros: A  single  virtual  Web  Ex  meeting  can  technically  have  people  at  various  geographical  locations  reducing  considerable  amount  of  time  and  saving  business  hours.File  attachments  can  be  shared  among  various  users  which  is  a  huge  bonus  as  instantly  people  can  check  and  also  provide  expert  comments.Meetings  can  be  recorded  which  is  extremely  helpful  for  future  use.Users  can  create  web  document  using  the  main  Web  Ex  meeting  site.
Review_cons: When  users  remotely  access  a  virtual  machine  sometimes  the  Web  Ex  meeting "doesn t",  work  properly  and  when  they  same  link  is  copied  back  to  the  users  physical  machine  it  starts  working  fine.
